casebody.data:
AMERICAN WOOD PRODUCTS CORPORATION, Appellant, v. CRANE COMPANY, Appellee. No. 7901. Circuit Court of Appeals, Sixth Circuit. Oct. 13, 1939. Oberlin, Limbach & Day and Snyder, Seagrave, Roudebush & Adrion, all of Cleveland, Ohio, for appellant. Offield, Mehlhope, Scott & Poole, of Chicago, Ill., and Hull, Brock & West, of Cleveland, Ohio, and Allen & Allen, of Cincinnati, Ohio, for appellee.

Before ALLEN, HAMILTON, and ARANT, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

The decree of the District Court, 29 F. Supp. 807, is affirmed for the reason that the patent in suit is invalid for want of invention.
